CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 21, 1959, pg. 1, reads: "Slayer on Trial - Mrs. Evelyn Griffin of 1517 Wylie Ave., escorted by a deputy, enters the courtroom of Criminal Court Judge Henry X. O'Brien where she is standing trial for the fatal stabbing of her husband, Charles, last Aug. 27, who caught her in a bedroom with another man. - Harris Photo." Portions of accompanying article read: "'Wife' Caught in Bedroom With Another Man Admits She Fatally Stabbed Mate - A 40-year-old common-law wife, of 1517 Wylie Ave., accused of fatally stabbing her spouse as her boy friend pinned him against a bedroom wall in husband's home, this week, was fighting to escape a first degree murder conviction in Criminal Court...Mrs. Evelyn Griffin of 1517 Wylie Ave., pleaded not guilty to the charge of murdering 58-year-old Charles Griffin, who caught the woman in a bedroom with another man...
TitMainTitle: Police deputy leading murder suspect Evelyn Griffin in courthouse hallway
